alfredsnippet.snippet:
Jacques Barzun, Science: the glorious entertainment, p.298

"[The historian] is not taken in by the generations' recurrent 'now we know.' He remembers witchcraft and phlogiston, vital force and luminiferous ether, Piltdown Man and therapeutic bleeding, and he wishes there were less hubris among the minions of intellectual authority."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Historians Know Better than Now We Know
